availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William E. Williams (Cumberland County, Kentucky, machinist.)

body.p: Cumberland County, Kentucky, machinist. Indiana native. Married to Martha Williams. Father of Rachel Williams, Robert Williams, William Williams, J.W. Williams, John W. Williams, and Mary S. Williams. Shingle maker in Troy, Indiana in 1850. Miller and machinist in Cumberland County, Kentucky in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Perry, Troy, p. 378A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland, District 2, p. 540.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Indiana, Boone, Marion, p. 168B.
Find A Grave, "William E. Williams (1823-1882)," Memorial #21460034, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/21460034 (accessed December 16, 2019).
